Harmful contagions can also induce behavioral effects that increase its spread, and the interplay between an infectious disease and changes in the underlying network structure has been studied at great length
35â€“ 42 . However, because the contagion is detrimental to the host, there is usually a tension between behavior of infected individuals, affected by the contagion to try to increase its spread, and that of the uninfected population, attempting to limit it. The spread of a purely beneficial contagion would not involve this tension and we expect different spreading dynamics.
